response.answer_text: That depends. Here’s something to think about: What’s your favorite restaurant? Now compare that to McDonald’s which is popular. Which is best? "Regardless of how you measure 'best' (elegance, deluxeness, impact, profitability, ROI, meaningfulness, memorability), it's almost never present in the thing that is the most popular." - Seth Godin So… As far as TEFL courses go who knows because the average person has only taken one course if that. I’ve taken 2 courses (a TESOL and a TEFL) and created my own. It depends on who you are going to teach. From my point of view the best TEFL is going to prepare you to do your job, be focused on teaching the students who you teach (adults or kids) and be similar to your job. Your point of view is probably a little different though. From your point of view you are just starting so you are thinking about getting a job and less about the teaching. I understand why you think that way, but I would focus on the learning and not the job because you’ll get a job that’s the easy part. The hard part is the teaching. The best “online” TEFL course is probably going to use multi-media and simulate actually being in a classroom. It’s going to be engaging and interactive. It won’t be a boring text-based course (like the cheap course on Groupon that I took) and it won’t be a passive experience. The best online course is going to take you into the classrooms where you will be teaching.It’s going to include a lot of video because people don’t remember text they remember video, but I am not talking about lecture videos.It will prepare you to teach the students you are going to teach. For example, if you are going to teach kindergarteners don’t take a course focused on teaching adults. Most courses like CELTA actually focus more on teaching adults.It probably won’t be cheap because a cheap course will be automated and there won’t be any tutors or feedback.It’s going to teach you real tools that you can put into action in the classroom not theory.It’s probably going to offer feedback/help on lesson plans and assignments. They’ll be communication with a real human. Best Online TEFL Course For How To Actually Teach English To Kids In Asia Online courses are not for everyone as some say they are “useless”. But that depends on you and the course. If you have ADHD, ADD or are a traditional learner you probably won’t do very well. You have to be a self-directed learner. TEFL stands for Teaching English as a Foreign Language. There are several institutes giving training for TEFL like Henry Harvin, Intesol India, ILSC. After completing TEFL qualification, it’s up to you where you go. Your TEFL certificate is your ticket to round the world travel and your certification is for lifetime. There are several institutes that teaches TEFL along with other courses like Henry Harvin. Henry Harvin which is jack of all courses and master of none could be a good starting point, but if you really want to crack TEFL then you should go to specialised TEFL training institutes like Asian College of Teachers or Intesol Worldwide. I have gone through several Institutes offering TEFL Courses online and find the best course is offered by Asian College of Teachers. Asian College of Teachers brings internationally recognized and accredited premium teaching courses endorsed by TQUK, an OFQUAL regulated awarding organization in England and all ACT students can qualify for Teaching Knowledge Test (TKT) by CAMBRIDGE. ACT is a Government of India Registered training company and member of All India Council of Education. Asian College of Teachers offers several course for TEFL which are as under : 120 hours international certificate in TEFL course :In this course trainees develop practical classroom teaching skills while gaining expertise in teaching English as a Foreign/Second Language in various learning and teaching centres around the world. It is an elementary level course that must be enrolled by those planning to enter the world of TEFL. 220 hours International Diploma in TEFL course :The course includes an in-depth understanding of the latest ESL/EFL teaching approaches used in diverse classrooms comprising of 21st Century learners. Bachelor's in TEFL :Bachelor's in TEFL is aimed at individuals who wish to pursue a career in TEFL and looking for a comprehensive program. The Bachelor's program is a 2 year training program that acquaints the candidates with both the theoretical as well as the practical aspects of EFL/ESL teaching across the globe. The Bachelor's degree is appropriate for those who want a thorough understanding of language acquisition. Master's in TEFL:Master's in TEFL is designed for those who are looking at a long and fulfilling career in ESL/EFL teaching as well as are interested to broaden their understanding and knowledge of TEFL/TESOL methods and approaches used in today's ESL classrooms and widen their horizon in the professional field of TEFL. The Master's program will act as a key professional credential preferred by employers. If you have a flair for teaching and want to travel the world and do job in your passion then getting TEFL certification is the best way to go. Which course you want to take depends upon how much time you are ready to give and how seriously you want to take teaching as your Carreer.
